article.title: Structure of the Milky Way stellar halo out to its outer boundary with blue horizontal-branch stars

multiple_choice_question.text: What distinguishes the HSC and SDSS filter systems in their ability to separate BHB and non-BHB stars?
choices: The HSC g-band response is more sensitive to surface gravity.
The SDSS u-band data provides a cleaner separation of stellar types.
The HSC z-band response is a better match to the Paschen series, which is sensitive to surface gravity.
The SDSS z-band data is less affected by contamination from BS stars.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of utilizing field stars outside the Sextans dwarf spheroidal galaxy?
choices: To determine the distance modulus of Sextans.
To identify potential stream-like structures in the Galactic halo.
To correct for contamination in the selection of BHB stars.
To estimate the total stellar mass of the Sextans galaxy.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the spatial distribution of BHB candidates within each survey region, as shown in Figure 3, primarily reflect?
choices: The inherent structure of the Milky Way\'s stellar halo.
The limited sky coverage and pencil-beam nature of each survey field.
The varying levels of contamination from BS stars in different directions.
The gravitational influence of the Sagittarius stream.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the likely cause of the excess BHB candidates observed at radial distances beyond ~300 kpc?
choices: The presence of a distinct halo substructure at large Galactocentric distances.
Contamination from faint galaxies misclassified as point sources.
The increasing contribution of BS stars to the BHB candidate sample.
A sharp increase in the stellar halo density beyond the Milky Way\'s virial radius.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the single power-law model for the radial density profile of BHB stars (Formula 15), what does the parameter "q" represent?
choices: The power-law index of the radial density profile.
The axial ratio of the radial density profile.
The density of BHB stars at the position of the Sun.
The break radius of the broken power-law profile.
